page.title: 09CHANGES IN WITHAM IN 20TH C.
page.content: { BEFORE 1914.} "That'S all Witham was ...Farm people or navvies on the Railway line"." As an agricultural village the average wage was about eleven bob to fourteen shillings a week." For women a new scource of work was the glove factory (Pinkhams) opened in 1911, paying 3 or 4 shillings per week.Many still worked for less as domestic servants."All down the High Street-all those houses were occupied by well to do people. Witham was considered to be very select- very snooty . {1914-1918 WAR.} "The 1914,you see, that war, everything went different then, that really, I think split the families.. after 1914 it wasn't Witham any more."
